centralQuestion: Should Utah invest more in tourism to stimulate its economy?

reasons.description: Tourism generates jobs, income, and tax revenues; policy analyses argue that targeted public investment in tourism infrastructure and promotion can amplify growth and competitiveness.

sources.title: OECD: 'Tourism Trends and Policies 2022 – Building resilience in the tourism ecosystem'
World Bank: 'Tourism for Development – policy insights and competitiveness'
Reuters: 'Eroding protections for public lands' (graphics explainer referencing surging recreation use)

reasons.description: Utah’s gateway communities rely on national park visitation; state actions to keep parks open during federal shutdowns are justified by the local economic dependence on tourism spending.

sources.title: Associated Press: 'Utah and Arizona will pay to keep national parks open if federal government shutdown occurs'
Reuters: 'States help run U.S. National Parks in federal government shutdown'
PBS NewsHour: 'Feds to let states pay to open national parks'

reasons.description: Investing in visitor management (e.g., reservations, shuttles, staffing and campground systems) is presented as a way to unlock more sustainable growth while improving the visitor experience.

sources.title: Resources for the Future: 'Understanding Campsite Reservations in National Parks'
OECD: 'Tourism Trends and Policies 2022 – Building resilience in the tourism ecosystem'

reasons.description: Tourism functions as a service export that channels outside spending into rural towns and small businesses; policy institutions highlight its role in regional development and SME growth.

sources.title: World Bank: 'Tourism for Development – policy insights and competitiveness'
OECD: 'Tourism Trends and Policies 2022 – Building resilience in the tourism ecosystem'

objections.description: Overtourism strains parks and nearby towns—crowding, degraded experiences, and infrastructure and staffing shortfalls—so additional promotion without management can worsen these problems.

sources.title: Associated Press: 'Gates will be locked and thousands of rangers furloughed at national parks if government shuts down'
Resources for the Future: 'Environmental Implications of the Tourism Industry' (includes national park congestion, citing Zion)
Reuters: 'Eroding protections for public lands' (graphics explainer referencing rising recreation use)

objections.description: Tourism dependence is shock-prone (pandemics, shutdowns), making overreliance a risky growth strategy for workers and small businesses.

sources.title: OECD: 'Tourism Trends and Policies 2022 – Building resilience in the tourism ecosystem'
PBS NewsHour: 'National parks are free, but some oppose that amid the outbreak' (gateway communities affected during COVID-19)

objections.description: Short-term rentals associated with tourism can worsen housing affordability by shifting units from long-term residents to visitors.

sources.title: Economic Policy Institute: 'The economic costs and benefits of Airbnb: No reason for local policymakers to let Airbnb bypass tax or regulatory obligations'
Urban Institute: 'With an abundance of short-term rentals, who wins and who loses?'
Associated Press: 'Maui mayor's plan to phase out vacation rentals would increase housing but shrink the economy' (tradeoffs case study)

objections.description: Tourism jobs are often low-wage and volatile—especially in leisure and hospitality—raising doubts about tourism-led growth as a pathway to broadly shared prosperity.

sources.title: Economic Policy Institute: 'Young workers hit hard by the COVID-19 economy' (leisure and hospitality suffered largest early job losses)
Economic Policy Institute: 'Hourly wages-and-benefits penalties for part-time work are large and persistent' (relevant to hospitality scheduling and job quality)

research.title: ‘The effect of tourism activity on housing affordability’ (Annals of Tourism Research, 2021)
research.description: Analyzes how tourism intensity, accommodation mix, and seasonality relate to housing affordability; finds tourism pressures can worsen affordability in destination municipalities.

research.title: ‘On the empirical relationship between tourism and economic growth’ (Tourism Management, 2020)
research.description: Studies 80 countries (1995–2016) and finds a positive long-run relationship between tourism development and economic growth, with heterogeneity across contexts.

research.title: ‘Tourism and Economic Growth: A Meta-regression Analysis’ (Journal of Travel Research, 2020)
research.description: Synthesizes evidence on the tourism-growth nexus across studies; reports that, on average, tourism is associated with economic growth while noting publication and methodological effects.

research.title: ‘Tourism-Induced Resilience of Rural Destinations in Romania’ (Sustainability, 2022) [Open Access]
research.description: Builds a mediation model showing how tourism can contribute to rural economic resilience depending on accessibility and structural features.

research.title: ‘Exploring the nexus between economic growth and tourism in Asia’ (Humanities & Social Sciences Communications, 2025) [Open Access]
research.description: Uses IV-GMM and PMG approaches across 35 Asian economies (2004–2020), finding bidirectional linkages between tourism and growth with asymmetric dynamics.
